content:
If this is in Windows, if you can see the top of your window where it shows the - box and x, you can resize your window to address the problem. If you click on the box and nothing changes, you may need to manually resize your window. Do not click on one of those three symbols. Instead, if you click and hold on a free space in that top potion, you can drag your window down and to left or right. Then, you can move your mouse until an arrowed line segment pointing up and down appears. Click and hold as you drag your window down so that it is a smaller size than it was before. Now, you should be able to see the bottom of your window.

If that is not the problem you are facing, please provide a greater description.

Thank you and good luck. KJK
creator: kauffman93

content: Yes, mozbackup has been a problem for a long time. Does not work. You should be able to salvage much of what you have. If you post screenshots of the content as viewed in windows file explorer, I think we can point out what can be imported into a new profile. Merging doesn't work, but if you know what components you want, you can do this manually.
creator: davidsk

content: This should work: - highlight folder - from menu bar, select View>Sort by and tick desired options.
creator: davidsk

content: If the recipient's email can handle .eml files, you could highlight them and rightclick and select forward>as attachment I don't like it, as that becomes a mess for recipient, but it does accomplish your intent in one email

content: That is because IMAP was never designed for high-volume moves or copy uploads. To do this, you will be best served (in my opinion), by creating manually-run filters to COPY (not move) messages, folder by folder, to the desired IMAP folder. When done, do some spot-checking to ensure messages are not corrupted (not likely, but possible, depending on network connection).
creator: davidsk
